littlecontraptions.ponder.basic_assemble: Powered Barge Assemblers mount attached structures to passing Contraption Barges
Without a redstone signal, it disassembles passing barge contraptions back into blocks
Similar to Cart Contraptions, you can attach larger contraptions using Chassis and Super Glue
littlecontraptions.ponder.basic_tug.head: Just the basics about tugs
littlecontraptions.ponder.basic_tug.text: Tugboats can be placed anywhere on water
Tugboats will naturally pathfind to Tug Route waypoints
Putting the Tug Route item in the Tug will start its journey!
Sometimes tugboats will get stuck on corners. This is fixable by using a corner guide rail
If the corner guide rail is facing the wrong way, use the conductor's wrench to flip it
littlecontraptions.ponder.tug_dock.text_: Docks can be used to stop the tugboats automatically while loading/unloading
Every docking station needs to have one tug dock block and a direct line of barge docks blocks
Barge docks can be switched from blue (wait for unloading) to orange (wait for loading) using conductor's wrench
To load the vessels, place a hopper on top of the dock
To unload the vessels, place a hopper below the water block
The tug will automatically wait until all vessels are fully loaded/unloaded
littlecontraptions.ponder.loco_dock.head: Docking the locomotive
littlecontraptions.ponder.loco_dock.text: Docks can be used to stop the locomotives automatically while loading/unloading
Every docking station needs to have one locomotive dock rails and a direct line of car dock rails
Train car docks can be switched from blue (wait for unloading) to orange (wait for loading) using conductor's wrench
To load the trains, place a hopper beside the dock
To unload the trains, place a hopper below the rail block
The locomotive will automatically wait until the whole train is loaded/unloaded
littlecontraptions.ponder.loco_route.tex: Automatic switch tracks let you create train routes that share stretches of rail
Routes are defined by waypoints by right-clicking with the locomotive route item
The locomotive will switch the rails automatically, selecting the branch that leads to the waypoint
Given two waypoints, the locomotive will select a branch with the closest waypoint that has not been visited yet
When the locomotive reaches a waypoint, it is marked as visited, this resets once all waypoints the route are reached
